website_summaries.verdict: This reasonably priced carrier can be adjusted to fit newborns from 7 lb. without an insert.
pros: Large, thick straps evenly distribute weight

customer_reviews.title: Great for small babies, and plus size mama's
customer_reviews.text: I just received this carrier today, I bought a k'tan previous, but got a size too big and felt like my baby wasn't secure enough. This carrier is easy to use. Its soft, and secure. I have a little baby, 2 months and 7lbs, and she fits perfect. I am also on the plus size, size 14 and this fits me and all my fluff! With a lot of extra legnth in the waist strap still! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: AJ524

customer_reviews.title: Better than all those popular “baby wraps”
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my 2 month old son doesn’t like sitting in the standard Ergobaby at his age and I cannot for the life of me figure out those other baby wraps. This is easy to use and the online video instructions on the Ergobaby website make it a breeze. My son protests a little initially and then settles down comfortably. This is not bulky and great for wearing baby. We will probably transition back to the Ergobaby 360 once he gets older. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ASZ

customer_reviews.title: You need this for your baby
customer_reviews.text: This is the best! I was so annoyed with the amount of fabric in different wraps, and was wanting something simple, easy, and comfortable. This carrier is perfect for my baby. It's so easy to get on and off, has great neck support for little man, and is comfortable on my back! My husband even likes to wear it around and says it's a must have. My baby falls asleep within minutes almost every time. Thank you ergobaby!!!
customer_reviews.author: Regina Filangee

customer_reviews.title: Bit this only if you want to have to hold your child while using this carrier..
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited about this carrier. What a swing and a miss. We have the Ergo 360 but my daughter seemed too big for the newborn insert and too small for it without one so I purchased this one hoping it would be our in between carrier. This carrier was terrible! It offers ZERO support and you cannot use it without having one hand supporting your child’s neck at all times. What is the point of a carrier if you have to hold your baby? It seems like they were designing this and halfway through gave up and released it to the public. So disappointed :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 5 starts for month old baby with reflux
customer_reviews.text: I have. 4-week old with reflux, who must be held upright for 30 minutes after he eats. I also am chasing after a 2-year old, and had been using a mo y type wrap to baby-wear the baby... THIS ergo carrier is a lifesaver. I save so much time vs the other type of carrier, yet this is still soft & very comfortable for baby and for me. It provides plenty of support for my newborn, yet is not overly cumbersome. I am SO PLEASED with my purchase & with this carrier!
customer_reviews.author: SallyKay

customer_reviews.title: Now you can do everything while wearing a happy baby!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this wrap and more importantly, so does the baby! I am doing laundry, working on my computer, and even exercising. I just did 30 minutes on the elliptical wearing the baby. I’ve done several postpartum cardio workouts with her. She literally doesn’t cry once she’s in. I think this simulates the womb for her. This wrap was expensive but worth every penny and much easier to put on than wraps without straps and buckles. I don’t feel like she could fall out and it frees both hands and gives her head enough support. It doesn’t bother my back either.
customer_reviews.author: Laura S

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this carrier! It's soft, super comfortable and baby is completely supported! It's very easy to get baby in and out and put on/take off. Worth every penny, 100%!
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: This definitely fits newborns but WARNING!
customer_reviews.text: This carrier would make my baby cry as soon as I would put her in it. Later I noticed that this carrier was CUTTING OFF THE CIRCULATION of my baby's legs. I have always used it according to instructions. Please do not try to rationalize it, theres no way this is safe ESPECIALLY not front facing. The cover digs into the baby;s thigh especially when front facing and cuts off blood flow.
customer_reviews.author: Erate

customer_reviews.title: Hands down best newborn carrier.
customer_reviews.text: After 3 dud carriers... finally one baby likes! Hats off to ergo baby for the design of this product. The soft wrap carriers such as moby and baby ktan are soft but lack structure and can be very complicated to put on quickly. This is so fast and simple while still being both soft and very supportive for my 1 month old. LOVE that you need no newborn insert! Take it from someone who has wasted a lot of time and money on carriers and buy this one!
customer_reviews.author: Sierra

customer_reviews.title: Mommy’s Helper
customer_reviews.text: This carrier is easy to strap on and comfortable to wear in anticipation of baby using it. It took a few wears within 2 weeks for my back to strengthen in order to be able to wear this long term without back pain from baby’s weight. After 2 weeks it’s very comfortable and I can get so much done around the house while my newborn sleeps in it. Love how lightweight the material is and soft on the skin.
customer_reviews.author: LYKC

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: After years of loving but struggling with the getting the original Ergo on when I was alone, this carrier is a dream. Super easy to use, very comfortable, and most importantly I can get my little one into it quickly. I own 5 carriers and this is my favorite. I’ll be sad when my little one out grows it. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jcl

customer_reviews.title: The easiest carrier to put on
customer_reviews.text: I have tried seven other carriers before finding this one. It is so easy to use, plus baby can be skin to skin while using it. It packs up very small, so it is easy to pack into a diaper bag. A must buy for parents wanting an easy to use carrier
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS ONE!
customer_reviews.text: I am absolutely IN LOVE with this carrier! I have two other carriers (an infantino flip, and a Baby K'tan) that I am not fond of. I've been searching for a nice hybrid carrier that offers the comfort of a wrap but ease of use that a buckle carrier has. THIS is it. THIS carrier is the one I've been searching for. It is so soft, and so simple to use. And my son felt nearly weightless in it. I am so pleased with this, and if you are having any doubts, JUST BUY IT! You won't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley C

customer_reviews.title: Best newborn/infant carrier
customer_reviews.text: I could not figure out how to use ring slings. I bought WildBird and never felt like my newborn was secure or supported. This carrier is amazing! We have the ergo baby for once he’s bigger but needed a newborn/infant carrier. This is it!! He’s so secure, comfortable, easy to put on (thank goodness).
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: Great newborn carrier.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this carrier. I find the slings and wraps hard to use and never feel secure to me and the other carriers feel to stiff for a newborn. I bought this out of desperation impulsively when baby girl was 1 week old and I am so glad it did. It is soft and stretch but supportive. It is relatively easy to use. I have had lots of compliments from other moms too. My main complaint is the cost but I’m guessing it will have good resale value. Baby is 2 months now and it’s still great for us.
customer_reviews.author: JMD

customer_reviews.title: More support than a wrap, less bulky than 360
customer_reviews.text: I bought this carrier because I needed something for around the house that had more support than a sling or wrap but was less bulky than the ergo 360 + infant insert. This seemed like a perfect blend. It definitely doesn’t have the level of lower back support that the 360 has, but I’ve found that I can wear it comfortably for much longer than a wrap. The crossed straps do provide a decent amount of support. I love how comfortable the fabric is too. This has been my go-to carrier with my newborn for the last month and a half and I don’t see that changing soon.
customer_reviews.author: whitb

customer_reviews.title: Best newborn carrier
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this baby carrier! I have tried so many baby carriers over my 3 kids. My third is now 2 weeks old now and we have tried several newborn carriers. This is by far the best carrier I have tried. She is so comfortable, snug and secure ...AND I'm not worried about user error like I am with baby wraps since this is so simple to use. I could not be happier!!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Not enough neck support
customer_reviews.text: No neck support for a newborn. I got this so I could wear my son around the house but this does not allow me to be hands free because I have to still support his head. I tgought I was wearing it wrong but I followed the instructions and YouTube tutorials. It just doesn't work for me.
customer_reviews.author: P. Ewing

customer_reviews.title: Best one I’ve tried
customer_reviews.text: I tried a bunch of different carriers and this one is my favorite for a small newborn baby. I am so happy that this is both soft, yet my baby stays put and doesn’t slip lower and lower throughout wearing. Best part is it’s easy to put on solo, I don’t need my husband to snap anything in the back ai can put it on when it’s just me and baby!
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. If you have a newborn or petite baby, this is the carrier for you!! So comfy, easy to use, supportive! Great for my small baby who gets swallowed whole by normal carriers!
customer_reviews.author: Grant & Savannah

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable carrier.
customer_reviews.text: This carrier is amazing. So light, not at all bulky, comfortable to wear, easy to put on alone, etc... I can’t wait to use this daily with my girl who loves to held ALL DAY. I had a cheaper carrier with my first and never used it because it wasn’t comfortable and I have the more expensive version of the ergo baby but don’t use it because it’s bulky and I hate feeling weighed down. This one is the absolute best compromise.
customer_reviews.author: Sophia Lynn

customer_reviews.title: My favorite baby carrier!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I have been searching for!! I have tried so many baby different baby carriers. the slip on sling wraps were so hard to get the right size and can be tricky to get baby in/out smoothly, and the convertible carriers are supportive but bulky with so many straps and clips. To me this is a perfect combination of the two.. simple and comfortable shoulder straps and the support of the waist belt. Nice adjustable clips for perfect sizing without adding bulk. And it just falls right off of baby’s back when unbuckled making it smooth and easy to lay my daughter down when she falls asleep being carried. Love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer charlton

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly if you’re looking for a soft baby carrier/wrap this is it!! The material is so soft!! It’s stretchy & I like the extra support buckles it gives me peace knowing baby is secure. I was searching for something that husband could use too he wasn’t a fan of my ring sling so I decided on getting a structured baby carrier & not feel bulky/padded like some.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Soft, adjustable, baby loves it

It can easily be adjusted according to infant height (eg newborn vs a little older babies). You can also adjust the sides and straps for your own (and baby’s of course) comfort level. Also, it doesn’t hurt your back. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: celeste001

customer_reviews.title: Pure love

customer_reviews.author: jason.ardans

customer_reviews.author: Rachel Keim

customer_reviews.title: Very cozy and easy to use

So far, he is tolerating it but he doesn’t feel as comfortable with it as with the SollyBaby wrap. I think he is secure in it though and sometimes falls asleep in it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My favorite carrier
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite carrier and I have tried 5 different ones! So lightweight and comfortable. The material is so soft.. my baby sleeps while wearing him and loves it too! Started using when my son was 1 week old... it supports his neck great.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could bring baby to the store with me while he was still too small for the shopping cart seat. I was looking for something easy and quick to use. This definitely works. And it grows with baby. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Carol A. Roach

customer_reviews.title: Love it!

customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: IN LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE! I’ve tried several baby wraps/carriers and this is by far the best. It is the perfect combination of a soft and flexible “sling wrap” and a more sturdy carrier. It is so easy to put on. My baby immediately fell asleep and i was able to get some stuff done and tend to my toddler! My baby is 22.25 inches long and this carrier says it’s for babies up to 23 inches which i think is pretty accurate but still absolutely worth it even if we only get a couple months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Merrill

customer_reviews.title: Great!

My daughter likes being in it when she’s fussy or fighting sleep. The shoulder straps are much more comfortable than others I’ve tried. Would recommend! Also not a terrible price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My 3 month old approves of it 😁.
customer_reviews.text: My 3 month old approves of it 😁. This is the only baby carrier I have ever bought and I am glad I made the right decision. However I would not recommend using this for long periods of time. It’s great for simple chores around the house, quick trip to the laundry room, or if your baby just needs somewhere to fall asleep and you still need to get things done. My daughter is about six months old and weighs about 16 pounds

customer_reviews.author: Ashley Frisella

customer_reviews.title: Great at first but..

customer_reviews.author: Ana C France

customer_reviews.title: Great carrier for post c section

customer_reviews.text: My baby doesn’t like it. She can’t breath because it covers her head. It’s too hot for her. She’s almost 3 months. Maybe when she gets older it will work better.
customer_reviews.author: CDN

customer_reviews.text: Seems like it would be comfortable but I have to return because the belt was sewn on the wrong way. Pretty annoying !
customer_reviews.author: Aimee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect wrap/carrier hybrid
customer_reviews.text: Was searching for something in between a wrap and a bulky carrier - this was the perfect solution. It’s soft and comfortable for baby, and lightweight but very sturdy for caregivers. I don’t feel like I have to constantly keep a hand on baby like I do when wearing in a wrap.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Super comfy and tons of support! Baby girl and I use this every day and love it

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for older babies
customer_reviews.text: This carrier is a great material and super soft for my son and I, but it just does not work with him. He’s 6 months and weighs 17 lbs so I face him outwards, but the neck part just chokes him. If I try to loosen it, then he’s way too loose. I’ll just stick to my old Infantino carrier.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, Smooth Material. Just perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight. Easy to shove into my bag or just keep on hand in the car. Easy to strap on. I can easily do it all by myself. Very snug and isn’t clunky and stuffy. My baby sleeps everytime I strap her up. Very smooth comfortable material.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I love this carrier. It’s buttery soft and lightweight enough for summer in the deep South! I tried a bunch of wraps but found them difficult or just annoying to deal with. This carrier is as soft as a wrap but way simpler to put on
customer_reviews.author: liz

customer_reviews.title: It's just okay
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this, but not super easy to get off and on. Just get the ergo 360 with the infant insert. save some money.
customer_reviews.author: Jazmin Lopez

customer_reviews.title: My Baby Did Not Care for It
customer_reviews.text: This is truly a review based on personal preference. My baby just did not like it and I didn’t feel like he was really that well supported.
customer_reviews.author: Allyson

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I love how comfortable this carrier is! My son is 9 months old and falls asleep almost as soon as I put him in it! He still fits perfect facing me!

customer_reviews.text: Love that it’s so easy to use, supportive and the fabric is beyond soft! Its a great middle ground between a wrap (which I find too difficult to put on correctly) and a more structured carrier that doesn’t feel as comfortable for infants. I’ll be sad when my baby is too big for it!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Vrabek

customer_reviews.text: I used this for my premie, it fit her tiny body perfect and I could snap/unsnap the latches by myself with one hand. I stopped using it when she reached 15lbs because I didn't like the way the carrier hung on me at that weight.
